title: Shifting functions with an integer range domain

blocks.name: fargshiftfv
blocks.content: If a class is a function, then the values of the "shifted function" correspond to the function values of the class. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 23-Nov-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm fargshiftfv(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {

  -| wceq(c4, cmpt(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)), cfv(c1, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))

  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, cn0), wf(c1, co(nat1, cfz, c0), cdm(c2))), wi(wcel(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, c0)), wceq(cfv(c4, c3), cfv(c1, co(c3, caddc, nat1))))), diffsc(s0, c2))

  imp(wa(wcel(c0, cn0), wf(c1, co(nat1, cfz, c0), cdm(c2))), wcel(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, c0)), wcel(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1))))
  sylan2(wcel(c0, cn0), wf(c1, co(nat1, cfz, c0), cdm(c2)), wi(wcel(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, c0)), wcel(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)))), wfn(c1, co(nat1, cfz, c0)))
  ffn(c1, co(nat1, cfz, c0), cdm(c2))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cn0), wfn(c1, co(nat1, cfz, c0))), wi(wcel(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, c0)), wcel(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)))), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), c0))
  fseq1hash(c0, c1)
  biimpd(wceq(cfv(chash, c1), c0), wcel(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, c0)), wcel(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1))))
  eleq2d(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, c0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), c0))
  eqcoms(cfv(chash, c1), c0, wceq(co(nat0, cfzo, c0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1))))
  oveq2(c0, cfv(chash, c1), nat0, cfzo)
  fvex(c1, co(c3, caddc, nat1))
  fvmptg(s0, c3, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)), cfv(c1, co(c3, caddc, nat1)), universe, c4, cfv(c1, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)))
  fvoveq1(cv(s0), c3, c1, caddc, nat1)

  diff.cfv.s(s0, c1, co(c3, caddc, nat1))
  diff.co.s(s0, c3, caddc, nat1)

blocks.name: fargshiftfo
blocks.content: If a function is onto, then also the shifted function is onto. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 24-Nov-2017.)

  sylanbrc(wa(wcel(c0, cn0), wfo(c1, co(nat1, cfz, c0), cdm(c2))), wfo(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)), cdm(c2)), wf(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)), cdm(c2)), wceq(crn(c3), cdm(c2)))

blocks.name: fargshiftfva
blocks.content: The values of a shifted function correspond to the value of the original function. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 24-Nov-2017.)
